assignments.description: Six written homework assignments: four individual and two team case studies.
Individual exam held in class during week 8.
Team project with oral presentation and written report.

policies.attendance: Class attendance + participation is required weekly.
policies.late_work: Assignments accepted up to one week late with a penalty.
policies.academic_integrity: Students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Accommodations for students with documented disabilities are provided.

additional_info.course_format: Lectures, in-class discussions, exercises, individual and team homework, midterm exam, and final project.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer skills, Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, high-speed internet, webcam, and microphone.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Disability Services for accommodations, mental health resources available.

_metadata.course_description: Decision-Making is one of the most important functions of Management. This course emphasizes understanding and formulating complex problems, developing decision models, and using them for effective decision making.
learning_outcomes: Follow a systematic and proven methodology for addressing complex problems
Select the appropriate optimization model and technique to apply in each case
Develop and solve optimization models in various domains
Use popular software packages for decision making
Analyze optimization models arising in data analysis
Analyze alternative scenarios and examine sensitivity of key strategy parameters
Develop simulation models and design simulation experiments
